page.title: 09DIALYSING (2) LITTLE MILL
page.content: When I became a local,I was adopted by an older villager,she became my "minder".She checks my blood pressure, helps me with the alarm system on the monitor and supplies me with food and drink throughout Dialysis.This lady is in her seventies now and still caring for me. The machine made a tremendous difference to me,my family and friends with my life regulated and to using the treatment three times a week. Tiredness became a problem because of lack of oxygen in my blood.My diet and fluid intake are restricted.Dialysis means a continual obligation. Some people in the village understand the illness but others are wary of the unknown.
